docs.lead_paragraph: THE first favorable public recognition of Sigmund Freud and the nascent theory and practice of psychoanalysis occurred in 1909, when Stanley Hall. then President of Clark University in Worcester, Mass., invited Freud and his colleague, Carl Gustav Jung, to give a series of lectures for the university's twentieth anniversary.

headline.main: Are We 'By Freud Obsessed'?; America's 'intellectual love affair' with some aspects of psychoanalysis is here analyzed and contrasted with the 'overt hostility' of many Europeans. 'By Freud Obsessed'?

docs.abstract: G Gorer article contrasts wide Amer acceptance of and overt Eur hostility to psychoanalysis
